channel.title: Mend.io Unified Release Notes
channel.description: Aggregated RSS, Atom, and HTML of all Mend release notes.

item.title: Mend for Bitbucket DC: Version 25.6.1.3 (01-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • Updated the org.eclipse.jgit dependency in the scanner and controller to version 6.10.1.202505221210-r to fix CVE-2025-4949.

item.title: Mend for GitLab: Version 25.6.1.3 (01-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • Updated the org.eclipse.jgit dependency in the scanner and controller to version 6.10.1.202505221210-r to fix CVE-2025-4949.

item.title: Mend for GitHub Enterprise: Version 25.7.1 (28-July-2025)
item.description:
Unified Agent 25.4.3-179 | Renovate 41.40.0 | Remediate 25.7.1 | Pre-Scan Builder (PSB) 25.4.1

New Features and Updates

  • CWE information is now displayed in the logs when available.

item.title: Mend for GitHub.com: Version 25.7.1 (27-July-2025)
item.description:
Unified Agent 25.4.3-179 | Renovate 41.40.0 | Remediate 25.7.1 | Pre-Scan Builder (PSB) 25.4.1

New Features and Updates

  • (SCA) Poetry 2.x project scans are now supported.
    This enhancement allows users to analyze dependencies defined and locked with Poetry 2.x using the same repo integration workflow, at no additional configuration overhead.

item.title: Mend Developer Platform: Version 25.7.1 (27-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • (Open Beta) The Developer Platform now supports custom configuration, partitioning, and scanning for monorepos. Applicable for both SCA and SAST.

  • (SCA) Poetry 2.x project scans are now supported.
    This enhancement allows users to analyze dependencies defined and locked with Poetry 2.x using the same workflow, at no additional configuration overhead.

Resolved Issues

  • Fixed a bug where non-admin users could click on the +Add button in the custom work items section of the Developer Platform settings. The button is now disabled for non-admins.

item.title: Mend CLI: Version 25.6.1.1 (10-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • (SCA) Hotfix: Fixed an issue where the CLI would incorrectly report an invalid organization token, leading to scan failure.

item.title: Mend AI: Version 25.7.1 (27-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • Detection of Azure AI Foundry models is now supported.

  • Introducing support for AI-specific license indices, including Mistral Research, Mistral Non-Production, and Llama4 licenses. Relevant information will be displayed in the AI Models table.

  • Added a new Behavioral Risk integration - OpenAI Compatible API.

item.title: Mend Container: Version 25.6.2 (13-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • Updated the UI for defining Kubernetes integrations that closely mimics the Registry integrations flow.

    • Added a Configuration step where users can define a schedule for automatically triggering a scan on the Kubernetes integration.

    • Additionally, the last scan time for Kubernetes integrations is now shown in the the My Integrations table.

item.title: Mend SAST: Version 25.6.2 (14-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • The workflow engine now allows users to use compliance standard violations directly as conditions, without needing to configure CWEs manually.

  • Introduced handling of historical findings older than 90 days. This ensures that previously suppressed findings will not reappear as new issues.

  • Introduced a detailed progress indicator for the code analysis in the CLI, giving users better visibility into scan progress.

  • Findings reports now include Violations, "Endpoint Access", and "Exploitable" data columns, enabling AppSec managers to efficiently assess and prioritize risks.

Resolved Issues

  • Fixed an issue where multi-line statements with a lambda function showed the wrong line number, pointing to the start of the entire statement instead of the lambda. Now, the line number shows exactly where the lambda is, so its easier to find and fix.

  • Fixed an issue where temporary variable names in the trace caused findings to mismatch with previous scans. This sometimes led to previously suppressed findings being incorrectly reported again.

item.title: Mend SCA: Version 25.7.1 (27-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • Introducing enhanced security visibility: View security violations directly within your libraries. New columns display violation counts, sortable and filterable, in both the main table and side panels, providing a comprehensive risk assessment for efficient prioritization and action.

  • Introducing new statuses in the Mend AppSec Platform for better tracking and alignment with remediation processes, maintaining backward compatibility with the Legacy SCA application. Added statuses include "In Review" and "Issue Created" for direct libraries. Existing status behaviors remain unchanged, ensuring seamless integration and workflow continuity across platforms.

item.title: Mend AppSec Platform: Version 25.6.2.2 (23-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • A new user type,Notification User, is now available for configuring email notifications
    for distribution lists and non-application users.
